stor::MonitoredQuantity

stor::MonitoredQuantity Class Reference

This class keeps track of statistics for a set of sample values and provides timing information on the samples. More...

#include <MonitoredQuantity.h>

List of all members.

Public Types

enum  DataSetType { FULL = 0, RECENT = 1 }

Public Member Functions

 MonitoredQuantity (double timeWindowForRecentResults=10.0)
void addSample (double value=1.0)
 Adds the specified sample value to the monitor instance.
long long getSampleCount (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the number of samples stored in the monitor.
double getSampleRate (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the rate of samples stored in the monitor (number of samples divided by duration).
double getValueSum (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the sum of all sample values stored in the monitor.
double getValueAverage (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the average value of the samples that have been stored in the monitor or 0.0 if no samples have been added.
double getValueRMS (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the RMS of the sample values that have been stored in the monitor or 0.0 if no samples have been added.
double getValueMin (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the minimum sample value that has been stored in the monitor.
double getValueMax (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the maximum sample value that has been stored in the monitor.
double getValueRate (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the sample value rate (the sum of all sample values stored in the monitor divided by the duration) or 0.0 if no samples have been stored.
double getDuration (DataSetType dataSet=FULL)
 Returns the amount of time (seconds) that this monitor instance has been processing values starting with the time of the first sample or 0.0 if no samples have been stored in the monitor.
void calculateStatistics (double currentTime=getCurrentTime())
 Forces a calculation of the statistics for the monitored quantity.
void reset ()
 Resets the monitor (zeroes out all counters and restarts the time interval).
void enable ()
 Enables the monitor (and resets the statistics to provide a fresh start).
void disable ()
 Disables the monitor.
void setNewTimeWindowForRecentResults (double interval)
 Specifies a new time interval to be used when calculating "recent" statistics.
bool isEnabled () const
 Tests whether the monitor is currently enabled.
double getTimeWindowForRecentResults () const
 Returns the length of the time window that has been specified for recent results.

Detailed Description

This class keeps track of statistics for a set of sample values and provides timing information on the samples.

Definition at line 22 of file MonitoredQuantity.h.

Member Function Documentation

double MonitoredQuantity::getSampleRate ( DataSetType  dataSet = FULL  ) 

Returns the rate of samples stored in the monitor (number of samples divided by duration).

The units of the return value are samples per second.

Definition at line 45 of file MonitoredQuantity.cc.

double MonitoredQuantity::getValueRate ( DataSetType  dataSet = FULL  ) 

Returns the sample value rate (the sum of all sample values stored in the monitor divided by the duration) or 0.0 if no samples have been stored.

The units of the return value are [the units of the sample values] per second (e.g. MByte/sec).

Definition at line 117 of file MonitoredQuantity.cc.

void MonitoredQuantity::calculateStatistics ( double  currentTime = getCurrentTime()  ) 

Forces a calculation of the statistics for the monitored quantity.

The frequency of the updates to the statistics is driven by how often this method is called. It is expected that this method will be called once per interval specified by EXPECTED_CALCULATION_INTERVAL.

Definition at line 141 of file MonitoredQuantity.cc.

double stor::MonitoredQuantity::getTimeWindowForRecentResults (  )  const [inline]

Returns the length of the time window that has been specified for recent results.

(This may be different than the actual length of the recent time window which is affected by the interval of calls to the calculateStatistics() method. Use a getDuration(RECENT) call to determine the actual recent time window.)

Definition at line 140 of file MonitoredQuantity.h.

double MonitoredQuantity::getCurrentTime (  )  [static]

Returns the current time as a double.

The value corresponds to the number of seconds since the epoch (including a fractional part good to the microsecond level). A negative value indicates that an error occurred when fetching the time from the operating system.
